intro: Picris hieracioides var. angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf wormweed, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and fields. Its narrow, lance-shaped leaves are covered in fine hairs, and it produces small yellow flowers in clusters. It is often used in traditional medicine for its purported anti-inflammatory properties.
